FacilityName: Titusville Water Treatment Plant - Garden Street

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps. The City of Titusville Garden Street Water Treatment Plant (Facility) complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, OSHA's PSM rule, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The chlorinator system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) state regulations.

The Facility is proactive regarding safety at its facility. The Facility has safety programs in place to prevent accidents, as well as respond to accidents, should they occur. The Facility's prevention programs include the following:

7 Risk Management Plan
7 Process Safety Management
7 Hazard Communication
7 Lockout/Tagout
7 Confined Space Entry
7 Fall Protection

To prepare for an emergency at the Facility, the operators have been trained in the following:

7 Respiratory Protection (SCBA)
7 Emergency Action and Fire Prevention (First aid, CPR)

The operators at the Facility are Florida State Certified professionals. The operators have years of experience safely handling chlorine. They receive updated training regarding operations and safety on a regular basis.


Five-year accident history. The Facility has never had an accident involving chlorine that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.


The emergency response program. In the event of an emergency involving the chlorinator system or the stored chlorine, it is Facility policy to notify 911 (Titusville Dispatcher) and request response to the emergency. Additional resources will be requested based upon incident circumstances.  We have discussed this policy with the City of Titusville Fire Department. Fire department personnel perform a general inspection of the facility on an annual basis.
